result.execSummary:
The defendant Ireland E Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ireland E Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ireland E Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay  mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV surcharge and the DNA surcharge.  Bail on deposit to apply, remainder to be paid within one year of today's date; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide a DNA sample.
Huber for work, child care and school; court does not object to electronic monitoring.
May not possess a firearm and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ireland E Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 667
cf

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by the parties. Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 45 days at the House of Correction with 6 days credit; Huber release for work, child care and school; court does not object to electronic monitoring.  Defendant to pay  mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV surcharge and the DNA surcharge.  Bail on deposit to apply, remainder to be paid within one year of today's date; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Defendant is to report in no later than 09/30/2015.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Parties are in court to continue the trial.
Sworn for the State:  Keisha E.  Exhibits 8 and 9 received.   State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense rests.  
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  The court found the defendant GUILTY as to count 1.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
On state's motion, court ordered count 2 dismissed.  
Defense counsel is asking for an adjourned sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are back in court to start the court trial.
Sworn for the State:  Ronald Edwards, Milwaukee Police Officer.  Exhibits 1 - 7 offered and received.  
Due to the inability to continue with the trial today, court ordered case adjourned for tomorrow in Branch 36.
  Court trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Both parties inform the court that they are ready to proceed to trial.
Received and filed:
Waiver of Jury trial.
The court passed the case until the p.m. to question the defendant as to the waiver and begin the court trial.
.....
  Court trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a final pretrial date.
Defendant asks the court to appoint new counsel.  The court denied that request.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 08/19/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
STATE SUBPOENA FOR AUGUST 19, 2015 @ 8:30AM RECEIVED AND FILED

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly M Schmidt for Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for a Scheduling Conference Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM020071  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/15/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.E. and her children.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ireland E Jones in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Ireland E Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Defense motion to dismiss Count 2, argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
